title: DJIA: Record Highs In Sight After Better-Than-Expected Q2 Earnings Season
text:
You’d never guess it amidst the latest headlines that the The We Company may be looking to postpone or that it's highly-anticipated IPO or that its job creation in the US is slowing, but major US indices are actually within 2% of their all-time highs.

While there are concerns about a potential slowdown in global growth heading into the end of the year, US corporations continue to thrive. According to the earnings mavens at FactSet, 75% of companies beat their Q2 earnings estimates and 57% of companies have reported better-than-anticipated revenues. While corporate earnings overall declined by -0.7% for the quarter, the decline was smaller than expected as the tailwind from 2018’s big tax cut faded.

After pulling back from record highs in late July, the formed a well-defined, 1,000-point sideways range between 25,400 and 26,400 throughout August. The index has now broken out above that area, completing a healthy correction within this year’s uptrend, and appears poised to retest the all-time high near 27,400. Meanwhile, the RSI indicator has formed a clear near-term uptrend of its own after briefly touching “oversold” territory below 30 last month, signaling that the momentum increasingly favors the bulls:
description: Stocks Analysis by Matthew Weller covering: S&P 500, Dow Jones Industrial Average. Read Matthew Weller's latest article on Investing.com
